In 2017, Seyi Shay released her second s.page_content:
Three years after the release of her widely acclaimed debut Seyi or Shay album, Seyi Shay is back with a new extended play titled Electric Package.

With the Electric Package EP, the singer embraces her wholeness as it embodies all of the musical influences and changes she has accommodated in the past years. It is a punch of indigenousness as litters of African elements are scattered throughout the project.

To further solidify her intention to diversify, Seyi recruits pan African music heavyweights; Vanessa Mdee from Tanzania, King Promise from Ghana, Nigeria’s Kiss Daniel, Slimcase and an array of top African DJs including; DJ Spinall, DJ Consequence and many others. The 6-track Electric Package EP is simply a musical buffet.

Get EP here

The top ten richest female musicians in Nigeria are Tiwa Savage, Yemi Alade, Omawumi, Nneka, Chidimma Ekileh, Seyi Shay, Asa, Waje, Madrinna, and Simi. Their net worth ranges from $1.5 million to $9 million (700 million naira to 4.1 billion naira).

The Nigerian music industry is a massive economic force generating billions of dollars annually and although it is largely dominated by male musicians, we’ve no doubt seen female icons top the charts and become household names for many years. I mean, who doesn’t know Asa or Waje? And what is “music” in Nigeria without Tiwa Savage? Learn about these 10 richest female musicians in Nigeria.

Tiwa Savage is the Richest Female Musician in Nigeria

Date of birth: 5 February 1980

5 February 1980 Age: 43 years old

43 years old No. of Albums: 3

3 Most Famous song: Kelekele Love, Somebody’s Son

Kelekele Love, Somebody’s Son Net Worth: $9 million

$9 million Other Sources of Income: Songwriting, Acting, Ambassadorial Deals

popularly and professionally known by her stage name “Tiwa Savage”, Tiwatope Savage Balogun tops our list of richest female musicians in Nigeria with a net worth of a whopping $9 million which is about ₦ 4 billion. Born on the 5th of February 1980 in Ikeja, Lagos State, Tiwa started off as backup vocals for American artists such as George Michael and Mary J. Blige until she got to sign a deal with Sony/ATV Music in 2009. The deal saw her writing songs for the likes of Babyface, Kat Deluna, Fantasia Barrino and Monica.

She is also known to have written Jaicko’s “Oh Yeah” which featured Snoop Dogg and Kat Deluna’s “Push Push” featuring Akon and David Guetta. Tiwa is also popular for her collaboration with Fantasia on the song “Collard Greens & Cornbread” which earned the American artist a Grammy nomination in 2010 when she established her own record label, “323 Entertainments” with her then-manager and husband “Tee Billz”.

In 2012, she joined Mavin Record after her manager cum husband decided to work together with Don Jazzy. She started to work on her debut studio album ‘Once Upon a Time’ which was launched in 2013 and featured artists like Sarkodie, Iceberg Slim, and General Pype. Her second album ‘R.E.D’ was released in December 2015 and it featured the likes of Don Jazzy, Olamide, 2face Idibia and Reekado Banks, among others.

Following the album’s success, it earned a nomination for ‘Best Album’ at the 2016 Nigerian entertainment awards. Today, Tiwa has grown to have three studio albums with her latest titled ‘Celia’ being released in 2020. She also has two EPs – Sugarcane and Water & Garri, which were released in 2017 and 2021 respectively.

She is, however, best known for hit songs, ‘Kele Kele Love’, Somebody’s Son (Ft Brandy), Stamina, Koroba, and even for her role in Spyro’s ‘Who’s Your Guy’ remix which topped the 4th most successful music video and garnered over 18 million YouTube views

As a singer and songwriter, Tiwa generates her primary income from record sales, show performance and online streaming. She is also an actress having appeared in a couple of films, including Colored Girls, the MTV series Sugar, and Funke Akindele‘s Jenifer’s Diary. Additional income for Tiwa Savage comes from brand endorsements for company brands like MTN, Twisco, Forte Oil, Maggi and, of course, a phone brand Tecno.

Yemi Alade

Date of birth: 13th March 1989

13th March 1989 Age: 53years old

53years old No. of Albums: 5

5 Most Famous Song: Johnny

Johnny Net Worth: $6.5 million

$6.5 million Other Sources of Income: Ambassadorial Deals, TV Shows, Clothing Lines, Jewelry Collection

Yemi Eberechi Alade who is best known by her stage name Yemi Alade is the second on our list of richest female musicians in Nigeria. The 53-year-old Afropop singer and songwriter began her music career in 2009 after winning that year’s Peak Talent Show. She began to attain more fame after releasing her first single “Johnny” in 2014.

Yemi Alade’s ‘Johnny,’ which tells the story of cheating and lying lovers on a fusion of high-life and afro-pop beat, became one of the biggest music in Nigeria, gaining over 150 million views on Youtube within a few weeks of its release. The song became her biggest single, topping several music charts in Nigeria. It also aided the success of her first studio album, King of Queens, released the same year

To promote her album and as well, earn a major income, Yemi toured several African countries, including Ghana, Kenya, and South Africa and as expected, King of Queens sold over 100,000 copies. March 25, 2016, saw Yemi Alade releasing her second album, Mama Afrika, and it contains a combination of Afropop, coupé-décalé, R&B, highlife, hip-hop, and pop. The album also featured various famous African artists and has hit tracks like “Do As I Do”, “Ferrari”, “Na Gode”, “Africa”, “Kom Kom”, etc.

About a year after, she released a new album titled Black Magic, featuring guest appearances from Falz and Olamide. In 2019 and 2020, she released two more albums – Woman of Steel, and Empress, respectively. However, the songs that contributed immensely to her financial growth and gained her international fame include Johnny, Shekere, Single and Searching, and Oh My Gosh.

Other contributors to her net worth are her brand endorsement deals with Globacom, Hollandia Yoghurt, Shell, and Close-Up. Also adding to her financial gain is her clothing line – The House of Tangerine, and jewelry collection, YAC. In 2017, she was one of the coaches in The Voice Nigeria showcasing Nigeria’s strongest undiscovered vocalists as they compete for an ultimate prize.

Omawumi

Date of birth: 13 April 1982

13 April 1982 Age: 41 years old

41 years old No. of Albums: 4

4 Most Famous Song: Bottom Belle

Bottom Belle Net Worth: $3 million

$3 million Other Sources of Income: Acting, Brand Endorsements

With a whopping net worth of $3 million, Omawumi Megbele makes it on the list of richest female musicians in Nigeria. The Itsekiri-born singer began her singing career in 2007 when she auditioned for Idol West Africa, a talent contest to find a recording artiste which aired on M-Net in 2007. Successfully reaching the 1st runner-up, Omawumi seized the golden opportunity to launch into the debt of her music career. Luckily, it paid off as she was able to release her debut single “In The Music” in September 2008.

While her debut single was gaining massive airplay across Nigeria, Omawumi was busy cooking her debut album which eventually came through in November 2009. Her debut album consists of tracks like “Chocolata” featuring Naeto C, “Serious Love Nwantinti” and “In The Music” which all gained massive public acclaim.

Today, the Bottom Belle crooner owns about five music albums with mind-blowing hit songs like “Play an Play”, “I no Sure”, “Me Ke”, “Hold Me Baby”, etc. Her music album includes Wonder Woman (2009), Lasso of Truth (2013), Timeless (2017), and Love Deep High Life (LDHL) (2021).

Aside from earning greatly from her music career, Omawunmi also makes reasonable income from her career as an actress which she kick-started in 2000 with a role on stage in that year’s edition of the V-Monologues. However, she made her screen debut in 2010 with the high-budget AMAA award-winning musical drama film, Inale.

She is also known for her role in Yvonne Nelson’s ‘House of Gold’, and for co-producing the film titled ‘She Is’, Alongside Waje. Omowumi served as a brand ambassador for many international brands, some of which include Globacom, Konga, and Malta Guinness. She also worked as a part of the campaign called Rise with the Energy of Africa.

Nneka Eguna

Date of birth: 24 December 1980

24 December 1980 Age: 42 years old

42 years old No. of Albums: 6

6 Most Famous Song: “Heartbeat”

“Heartbeat” Net Worth: $3 million

Though one of the oldest in the music industry, Nneka Lucia Egbuna is also one of the richest female musicians in Nigeria. She is a Nigerian singer, songwriter and actress best known for singing in English, Igbo and Nigerian Pidgin. Nneka first gained public attention in 2004 while performing as an opening act for dancehall reggae star, Sean Paul at Hamburg Stadtpark.

Thereafter, she decided to work on her own album but first, she released an EP, The Uncomfortable Truth which was no less a success. Following much acclaim, she released her debut album, Victim of Truth, across Europe, Nigeria and Japan. Her second album, No Longer at Ease, was released in February 2008. Today, she boasts of six successful music albums with two compilations, three EPs, and tons of hit singles which have helped her build meaningful income and fame to go with it.

Nneka makes her income from music tours. She performed on her first tour in April 2005, after the release of her debut EP, and she played shows in Germany, Switzerland and Austria. She also toured in France, Italy and Portugal for her second album. Her first concert tour of the United States saw her visiting places like New York City, Vienna (Washington DC), Boston, Philadelphia, Los Angeles, and San Francisco.

Nneka’s lyrics reflect much of her history, life in Nigeria and the time spent in Western Europe. Her songs stress the issues of capitalism, poverty, and war. Some of her most successful hits include “Shining Star” and “Heartbeat” which garnered over 20 million YouTube views each and made it to some top music charts.

Chidinma Ekileh

With her impressive net worth of $2.8 million, Chidinma gets herself enlisted as one of the richest female musicians in Nigeria. The 32-year-old Nigerian Songstress, songwriter and stage performer gained prominence after winning the third season of Project Fame West Africa.

Chidinma started singing at the tender age of six, yet, while growing up, music was not a career path she was willing to follow. However, with the convincing powers of her loved ones, she decides to give it a try and today, she is listed among the richest female singers in Nigeria. Chidinma is arguably one of the youngest females in the music arena of Nigeria.

Of course, her first root stems from the music talent reality TV show which saw her go home with a deal, a fortune and a car. Her next big financial break followed the release of her “Emi Ni Baller” music video which helped her become the first female musician to peak at number 1 on the MTV Base Official Naija Top 10 chart.

2011 Chidinma birthed her debut and only album called “Chidinma”. It contains sensational singles like “Jankoliko” and “Kedike,” a track title that also became her byname “Miss kedike”. Her song “Emi Ni Baller” which was produced by Legendury Beatz, peaked at number 7 on Vanguard‘s list of the Top 10 songs that made 2013

After an awkward disappearance in the music industry, she resurfaced in 2013 with the singles “bless my hustle” featuring Phyno and “oh baby” featuring Flavour. She also released other singles like “Kite” and “Jolly” which equally received positive ratings. Like every other musician, Chidinma made huge income from album sales and streaming platforms.

As a celebrated artist, Chidinma makes additional income from endorsement deals she signed with companies like MTN and Molped. She made her acting debut in Kunle Afolayan’s 2017 film The Bridge, playing the role of Stella, an Igbo lady whose personal relationship is threatened by tribal prejudice and parental plans. She was one of the supporting acts on the 2013 Hennessy Artistry Club Tour headlined by D’banj.

Chidinma has won several awards but the KORA awards still remain her biggest achievement. She won “The Best Female West African Act” category at the KORA awards held in ivory coast in 2012.

Seyi Shay

Date of birth: 21 December 1985

Seyi Shay’s jaw-dropping net worth is a product of her hard work and dedication to her musical career which she began at an early age. Born into a music family, Seyi Shay picked up an interest in music and was a choir member since the age of six.

In 2006, she landed a record deal with a record label, No Apology, and was also part of a UK-based girl band called Boadicea. While with the record label, she partook in the British Pop/RnB Girl Band “From Above” and emerged as the lead vocalist for the group.

She, however, began to make meaningful income for herself after meeting the late Sound Sultan who advised her to move back to Nigeria, and since her return, she has remained a dominating force in the entertainment industry. She has worked with the likes of Wizkid, Timaya, Vector, Olamide, Yemi Alade and a host of others.

Under Cecil Hammond’s record label, Fly Time Music, Seyi Shay launched her solo career in Nigeria and promotes her brand. She produced her singles “Loving your way” and “No le le,” which became hit songs and brought her into stardom. She made hit after hit, including singles like “Irawo” and “Chante” which further boosted her musical career.

The superstar’s debut album, “Seyi or Shay”, was released in 2015 while her second studio album titled “Electric Package” followed in 2018. Her talent has also taken her to several cities in many countries where she amazed the audience with her wonderful voice. Seyi also did a bit of acting as well. She appeared as Lara Giwa in the 2018 movie Lara and the Beat

Shay’s musical career is the major source of her growing income with songs like “Yolo Yolo garnering over one million YouTube views which in turn, translates to thousands of dollars. Aside from music, she also makes meaningful income from brand endorsement deals with companies brands like Pepsi, 9mobile, and Barcadi freezer.

ASA

Bukola Elemide, popularly known as ASA, is a Nigerian-French vocalist and one of the best artists in Nigeria, thanks to her music style that mostly contains pop, indie pop and afro beats. Asa has long been a lover of great music and she drew her inspiration from the collection of her father’s playlist.

Asa’s music career gained momentum after her encounter with q1Cobhams Asuquo, who became the producer of her first studio album Asa (Asha). She, however, rose to fame after releasing her back-to-back hits songs with the likes of “Eye Adaba,” and “Jailer”, to mention a few.

Asa’s album (Asha) went far across Europe, Asia, and Africa. She also went on to win the prestigious French Constantin Award in 2008 when she was voted as Best Fresh Talent of 10 singers or groups by a jury of 19 music-industry specialists in Paris.

Her second album, Beautiful Imperfection, was released on the 25th of October 2010. She collaborated with French composer, Nicolas Mollard and it went platinum in 2011. By 2014, she had sold up to 400,000 albums worldwide. Again in 2022, she released another album, “V” where she featured Wizkid, Cavemen and Amaarae.

Her plenty of great hit songs not only got her a major income but also offered a good stance to sign endorsement deals worth numerous Naira with GTBank after recording the main tune for them. Her music and endorsements are no doubt good sources of the $2 million net worth she currently enjoys

Waje

The Ondo State-born singer Aituaje Aina Vivian Ebele Iruobe, popularly known as Waje, started singing in church but she officially began her singing career in 2007 while at the University. She did lots of free shows and gigs until she gained her first rise to prominence featuring on the remake of P-Square’s “Omoge Mi”.

More so, her appearance in P-Square’s hit track titled “Do Me” gained her further rise to prominence, particularly across Africa and some parts of Europe. While working on her career, Waje also featured in a good number of hit songs by famous artists like Tiwa Savage and Dencia.

She became more famous after working with M.I. to produce a song titled “One Naira”. In 2013, she released her self-titled debut studio album Words Aren’t Just Enough (W.A.J.E). She also released Red Velvet and Heart Season (EP) in 2018 and 2021, respectively. her latest album WAJE 2.0 was released in 2022 and as expected it received wide positive ratings.

While music was initially a major share of Waje’s financial income before she quit in 2019, the Soul singer also makes additional income from show hosting, acting, brand endorsements and as a producer. One of the known shows she appeared in was The Voice Nigeria, where she was one of the judges alongside other Nigerian musicians, including 2face Idibia, Timi Dakolo and Patoranking.

Together with her friend and co-artist Omawumi, she launched Hermanes Media, a media company that specializes in film and TV production, adverts, content curation, brand event activation, and creative digital marketing. Waje debuted as an actress in 2014, appearing in the film Tunnel alongside Femi Jacobs, Patrick Doyle, and Nse Ikpe-Etim. She also played a role in the 2019 movie She Is.

Cynthia Ikponmwenosa Morgan popularly known as Cynthia Morgan, now Madrina, is a Nigerian singer, rapper and songwriter who has gone on to win herself lots of hearts through her musical talents. As a reward, she is recorded as one of the richest female musicians in Nigeria. Madrina began singing when she was 3 and was a backup singer for her mother’s music band at the young age of 14. But professionally, she debuted in 2008 with the release of her song ”Dutty Stepping” and gained immense fame when she was featured on Jhybo’s single ”Ejo le fe ro”.

So spectacular was the song that it went on to receive several awards. Some months before Ejo le fe ro” was released, she was known for her songs ”Don’t Break My Heart” and “Lead Me On” which earned her deserving fame and a financial balance. Her songs proved popular and reached the top positions on music charts. She won many awards for her amazing singles.

Madrina took a break from her music career in 2020 after she lost the right to use her stage name ”Cynthia Mrgan” due to her contract deal with Jude Okoye. Though not much of her have recently been seen, Madrina’s net worth has continued to grow thanks to her many singles that hit top chart boards.

These songs include German Juice, I’m Taken, Right Move, Ojoro, Popori, Asampo, High High High, Come and Do, One Blood, Simati Niya, Billion Dollar Woman, Jamo, GoGaga, Kuchi Kuchi, Dubai, Bubble Bup, Breaking Bonds, Olowo, Konti Hobi, Bang Bang and Twerk It. She has also won notable awards, including South-South Music Awards, Nigeria Entertainment Awards, and ELOY Awards.

Simi

Simi began her professional music career as a gospel artist but years later she opted for secular songs and became famous following the release of her first debut studio album titled “Ogaju” in 2008. Her album which contained songs like “Iya Temi” and “Ara Ile” helped her gain meaningful balance in the music market.

January 2014 saw Simi releasing a five-track EP, Restless, which helped her land a record deal with X3M Music. Rihanna’s “Man Down” and Adele’s “Set Fire to the Rain” are two of the EP’s well-known covers. Also included in her most successful tracks are “Tiff” and “E No Go Funny” which were released on January 9th. Both tracks were well-accepted by the music industry and garnered favourable reviews from reviewers.

Simi’s second studio album, Simisola, was released on September 8, 2017, and her third, Omo Charlie Champagne, Vol. 1 was released two years after. Her latest album, To Be Honest, was released in 2022 and it performed excellently in the music market. With over 20 songs to her name, Simisola has practically done it all from cult classics like “Jamb Question” with over 7 million views on YouTube to national hits like “Joromi”, “Ayo”, and “Smile for Me” with 17 million, 13 million, and 10 million views, respectively.

Aside from winning over 13 awards and making huge incomes from record sales, YouTube views and online streaming, Simi built her net worth from her career as a songwriter and a sound engineer. She is credited with mixing and mastering Adekunle Gold’s debut studio album, Gold, which was released in July 2016. No wonder why she is one of the richest female musicians in Nigeria currently. She also has a record label, ‘Studio Brat”, and a clothing line BLC (Big Little Company) from where she makes additional income.

The Top 10 Richest Female Musicians in Nigeria are:

TDeborah Oluwaseyi Joshua better known by the stage name Seyi Shay is a Nigerian-based singer-songwriter, recording artist, performer, and actress. She released Seyi or Shay, her debut studio album in 2015.

Prior to this, Seyi has written and produced soundtracks and songs for Konami games, Melanin C, and Chipmunk. Internationally, Seyi is regarded as one of the biggest African artists.

Early Life

Deborah Oluwaseyi Joshua was born on December 21, 1985, in Tottenham, London England as the last of four children. She was born to Nigerian parents. Her mother is from Northern Nigeria and her father, the western part of the country, Osun State. Seyi and her siblings were raised by their mother.

Seyi started visiting Nigeria at age 2. Then, for her secondary school education, she attended Command High School, Maryland, Lagos. Thereafter, she returned to London for her undergraduate studies. Firstly, she attended a local UK college where she studied music and then moved on to the University of East London, and earned a degree in Business Management.

Career

Seyi started her music career early enough. Her motivation came from her late mother and siblings who were also involved in music in different ways. At age 6, she was already performing in her school choir. Later, at 14, she performed for the London Community Gospel Choir (LCGC) in their world-wide tour which included 13 cities in Japan.

Shay signed her first record deal with No Apology, a record company in affiliation with George Martin (Fifth Beatle). In 2006, she formed a girl Band, Boadicea. The band was managed by Ron Tom, founder and manager of All Saints and Sugarbabes. However, it was disbanded in 2008.

Also, Seyi wrote and produce sound track for the Konami Game Crime Life, wrote You Will See for Mel C and White Lies for Rapper ChipMunk. While collaborating and performing, she partook in the British Pop/RnB Girl Band From Above, and emerged as the lead vocalist for the group.

From Above signed a record deals with Sony/Columbia and Mathew Knowles’ Management company. Before disbanding, the group achieved some goals. For instance, it made an online release of Breaking From Above, an MTV Reality Show that aired in over 166 countries.

Apparently, Seyi has worked with numerous bigwigs in the music industry both locally and international.

Music Career In Nigeria

Sound Sultan motivated Seyi’s return to Nigeria during one of his visits to London in 2011. Thereafter, she heeded his advice and came to Nigeria to promote her career in the industry. On her arrival, she was introduced to Cecil Hammond who signed her under the Flytime Music label. In 2012, she released a single, Irawo. Irawo became a hit and garnered massive airplay in Nigeria.

Later on, she left Flytime Music. Thus, in July 2015, Seyi signed an international record deal with Universal Island Records UK which distributes her music worldwide.

Albums And Songs

Seyi has released many hit singles. She released her debut studio album in 2015, and one EP titled Electric Package in 2018.

Seyi Or Shay

Seyi or Shay is the debut studio album of this talented singer. She started working on it in 2011, and in 2015, it was released under Island and Stargurl Limited. Seyi or Shay is preceded by five singles which include; Murda (2014), Crazy, (2014), Jangilova (2015), Right Now (2015) and Right Now ‘Remix’ (2015).

It incorporates a genre of RnB, afropop, dancehall and soul and it expresses the two sides of the singer as a person and musician. It featured vocals from Sound Sultan, Wizkid, Iyanya, Banky W, Femi Kuti, Flavour, Shaydee, D’Banj, Timaya, Cynthia Morgan, and Patoranking. The producers include Legendury Beatz, Dokta Frabz, Harmony Samuels, Del B, Pheelz and Tee-Y Mix.

Seyi Shay As A Featured Artist

As a superstar vocalist, Seyi Shay has collaborated with several artistes. She was featured by Wizkid; In Love, Mr Walz; Paradise, Praiz; For You, Yarinya; Amir and many more.

She has also worked with several local and international artistes. Some of which include; Justin Timberlake, Brian Michael Cox, Cameron Wallace, Cynthia Morgan, M.I Abaga, Olamide, Eva Alordiah, Yung Greg C, e.t.c

Philanthropy

Due to Seyi’s love for the girl-child, she established a charity, Shay A Ray of Hope in 2015. The charity focuses on the underserved children, women and most especially helping the girl child.

In addition, Seyi has continued to use her international fame to promote justice for women. For instance, she joined in the UN campaign to empower women and collaborated with some other world entertainers in the remaking of the Spice Girls’ Wannabe video. The video was presented in UN General Assembly.

Also, as an ambassador for Genevieve Pink Ball Foundation, she sang the song Because we care. The aim of the song is to give hope and encourage breast cancer patients. She is also a staunch supporter of Slum 2 School projects.

Net Worth

According to infoguidenigeria.com, Seyi’s net worth is estimated at $2.1million.

Seyi is a brand ambassador to Barcardi Freezer along with Sean Tizzle and Yemi Alade. Similarly, she was endorsed as an ambassador to Samsoon Telecomunication, a service provider to Etisalat now 9jamobile.

Additionally, in 2015, she joined Wizkid and Tiwa Savage as brand ambassadors to Pepsi. In 2016, Nigeria Stock Exchange unveiled her and Burna Boy as ambassadors. And in 2017, she became the face of Gionee phone brand.

Awards And Recognition

Seyi has been nominated for several awards such as The Headies, Channel O, MTV Africa and many more. Below are few of the awards in her possession;

New Musician of the Year, City People Entertainment Awards, 2013

Choice Female Artist of the Year, Nigerian Teen Choice Awards, 2015

Best Collaboration of the Year, Nigerian Entertainment Awards, 2015

R&B Artist of the Year, Nigerian Entertainment Awards, 2016

Exemplary Female Artist, Nigerian Ten Choice Award, 2016

Afropop Artist of the Year, Nigeria Entertainment Awards, 2017

Seyi Shay set to Drop New Album 'Big Girl' Featuring Wande Coal and Teyana Taylor | SEE DETAILS

Nigerian songbird, Seyi Shay is prepared to drop a new album titled Big Girl on the 9th of November which features the likes of Wande Coal and Teyana Taylor.

Seyi Shay held a listening party for her new album, Big Girl last night in London where the details of the new project were revealed. This was shared via Instagram on Friday, the 23rd of October 2021.

Seyi Shay (Real Name: Deborah Oluwaseyi Joshua, born 21 December 1985) is a United Kingdom-born Nigerian singer-songwriter, recording artist, performer, and actress who has an estimated net worth of $4.5 million. She is known for several of her songs such as ‘Right Now’ and ‘Irawo’.

Only a handful of female artists have succeeded in making a huge breakthrough with their singing talent, and their efforts largely impact the Nigerian music industry. One of such women with an excellent career in the industry is Seyi Shay. As a reward for her efforts, Seyi Shey not only boasts a massive fan base but also a mouth-watering net worth estimated at $4.5 million.

Seyi Shay is undoubtedly one of the reigning queens of the Nigerian music industry, thanks to her ability to churn out some chart-topping hit after hit.



Seyi Shay Profile Summary Birth Name: Deborah Oluwaseyi Joshua

Seyi Shay Hails from Osun State, South-West Nigeria

The Afropop singer is one of many Nigerian celebrities who were born abroad. She was born in Tottenham, London, England, to Nigerian parents who named her Oluwaseyi Odedere. Seyi’s father is an indigene of Ife (a town in Osun State, South West, Nigeria), which means the singer’s ethnicity is Yoruba. However, her mother hails from one of the Northern states in Nigeria. Nothing much is known about her parents and siblings except that they lived in the United Kingdom for many years.

Seyi spent her early years in England until she was 2 years of age when she started visiting her home country, Nigeria. She eventually relocated to Nigeria, where she completed her high school education at Command High School, Maryland, Lagos State. She holds a degree in music and business management, which she obtained from a local UK college and the University of East London, respectively.

Her Family Has an Extensive Background in Music

Being born into a family with proximity to a certain profession could help you develop a special interest in it, gain inside knowledge, and even be privy to career-centered opportunities that others may not have access to. This is a true situation for Seyi Shay, who grew up among family members with a passion for music. Shay was raised by her single mother, who, as a Christian, was a church chorister. She has three siblings- two brothers, one of which was a prominent club and radio DJ in London, and a sister who used to compose songs for the BBC.

It took Seyi Shay only a few years to master some aspects of music, after which she decided to pursue a professional career in music. At the young age of six, Shay joined her secondary school choir to perform for the London Community Gospel Choir during their world tour, which included 13 cities in Japan. She was also a member of several musical groups over there. Her talent has also taken her to several cities in many countries, where she wowed the audience with her wonderful voice.

Her participation in the competition further fueled her passion for pursuing music as a career. When it was time for Seyi to take up courses that would help her boost her career in music, she faced strong opposition from her mother, who wanted her to become a doctor or lawyer. However, before her death, her mother told her to focus on her music career and put God first.

A Look At Seyi Shay’s Breakthrough in the Music World

Being a successful female musician in a competitive industry dominated by men is not an easy feat. It requires talent, prowess, effort, expertise, and a lot of hard work, and Seyi Shay has proven she has all it takes to take over the music industry in her home country and beyond. Her music career started when she signed her first music deal with the record label No Apology, and afterward, formed a UK-based girl band called Boadicea in 2006. However, the group went their separate ways two years later.

The Nigerian-based artist became the group’s lead vocalist after she won the highly-coveted ”From Above UK singing audition,” which led to the group signing a deal with Matthew Knowles’ management company and undergoing serious vocal and dance training. The girls also launched their own MTV reality show titled: “Breaking From Above” (it aired in over 166 countries worldwide) and were also present at the 2011 MTV Europe Music Awards, where they presented an award to recipients.

Seyi Shay later scored a recording deal with Sony and has continued to move from one level of success to another. Her return to Nigeria to pursue her music career was inspired by Nigerian rapper and singer Sound Sultan, who she met in London in 2011. After listening to her demos, Sultan convinced her to relocate to Nigeria and pursue her musical career. Under Cecil Hammond’s record label Fly time Music, Seyi was able to launch her solo career in Nigeria and promote her brand. The superstar’s debut album “Seyi or Shay” was released in 2015, while her second studio album titled: “Electric Package” followed in 2018.

Her Awards and Recognitions

In addition to gaining a huge fan base, Seyi Shay has also received awards for a job well done in most of his hit songs. Her name was first listed for an award in 2013 when her song ‘Irawo’ was nominated for the ‘Best Vocal Performance (Female)’ award category at the year’s Headies. While she lost it to Nikki Laoye’s “Only You,” Shay received her first award at the City People Entertainment Awards for the ‘Best New Musician of the Year (Female)’ category. Her next and latest award won was at the 2019 Headies, where she received the award for the ‘Best R&B Single’ category for her song “Gimme Love,” which was released in 2018.

A complete list of awards Seyi Shay has won so far include

2013 City People Entertainment Awards for ‘Best New Musician of the Year (Female)’ category

The Headies (2019) awards for ‘Best R&B Single’ category

How Seyi Shay Accrued Her $4.5 Million Net Worth

Sold-out tours, hit songs, endorsement deals, concerts, enviable accolades, huge fan base, and global achievements are some of the ranking factors of the best in the music industry. Though not the richest compared to Tiwa Savage, Yemi Alade, and Omawumi, Seyi Shay is definitely one of the richest female artists in the Nigerian music world.

She could be rated as one of the top five of the most successful female artists in the country, thanks to her talents and hard work. Seyi is one woman with many talents – she sings, writes, and records songs, but beyond that, she has garnered much income from various other channels. Let’s take a look at some of the ways Shay was able to gain her financial stance.

Her Music Career

Ever since Seyi Shay broke into stardom with her talent, she has been in the spotlight for outstanding performance on stage and collaborating with several big artists like Michelle Williams, Justin Timberlake, Rob Knoxx, Brian Michael Cox, and many others. According to several websites, she makes her highest income from her music career. Musicians like Seyi Shay make money from royalties, advances, playing live, selling merchandise, and licensing fees for their music.

Although the exact amount she made from selling thousands of her records while also performing at numerous shows, tours, and events across the globe is unknown, it is quite clear that the Afropop star has left no stone unturned in ensuring those areas are covered. Her biggest performances include the Darey Art Alade’s Love Like A Movie concert held on 15 February 2014, the 2013 COSON song awards, and one of Big Brother Africa 8’s live eviction shows.

Shay’s record label signings with Island Records and the universal music publishing group were six-figure deals that surely lined her pocket with a few more millions. One of her hit songs, Yolo Yolo, has garnered over a million views, translating to thousands of dollars for her. The music video was also nominated at the 12th edition of The Headies for Best Music Video, and it became Bailey’s commercial soundtrack for the West and Sub-Saharan Africa.

Endorsement Deals

Like most other music stars, Seyi Shay earned part of her net worth from side gigs, including brand endorsements. One of her earliest deals was signed in 2013, with telecommunications service provider Etisalat, now known as 9Mobile. In 2015, the ‘Right Now’ crooner joined music stars, Wizkid and Tiwa Savage as ambassadors for the world-class beverage company Pepsi. This came after she signed a 2-year contract with the company. In 2017, she bagged an endorsement deal with Gionee, another telecommunications company.

She Also makes Money From Acting Gigs

Seyi Shey added acting to her career list after playing a role in Urenna Ukiwe’s 2018 drama film, Lara and the Beat. The 137 minutes film, which talks about two sisters, Lara Giwa and Dara Giwa, who were stripped of their wealth due to a financial scandal that ruins their father’s empire, has Shay playing Lara Giwa.

She shared the screen with Saheed Balogun, DJ Xclusive, Uche Jombo, Chioma Chukwuka, and Chinedu Ikedieze. The drama premiered on July 8, 2018, and grossed up to N31 million at the box office. This is her first lead role in a Nollywood film. It is not known if she has made further appearances to date.

Seyi Shay is Currently Single

The Afropop singer is still in the market. In other words, she is not married yet but could do so sometime in the future. It is unknown to the media if she is secretly dating someone, but her fans are pretty sure she would show her man to the world someday. More so, Shay has no children of her own neither has she been in the news for getting married to a man previously.

Where is Seyi Shay from?

Shay was born in London, England to Nigerian parents. Her mother was from Northern Nigeria and her father is a native of Ife.

Seyi Shay age

The singer was born on 21st December, 1985. This means that she is 35 years old as of 2020.

What is Seyi Shay real name?

Her real name is Deborah Oluwaseyi Joshua (born Oluwaseyi Odedere)

Seyi Shay in braids. Photo: iamseyishay

Source: Instagram

Family and upbringing

Shay has two elder brothers and an older sister. She and her siblings were raised by their single mother.

Seyi Shay grew up in a religious setting and felt like a single child during her adolescence.

Her interest in music was influenced by members of her household. Her late mother was a chorister and her sister used to compose songs for TV. Her brother, on the other hand, was a radio and club disc jockey.

Seyi lived in the United Kingdom and was a member of several musical groups over there.

Education

She attended the Command High School in Maryland, Lagos before returning to London for her undergraduate studies.

She holds a degree in Music and Business Management which she obtained from a local UK college and the University of East London respectively.

Career in music

Seyi started her music career when she was still a child. Her motivation came from her late mother and siblings, who were also involved in music in different ways.

At the age 6, she was already performing in her school choir. Later, at 14, she performed for the London Community Gospel Choir during their world tour, which included 13 cities in Japan.

Shay signed a record deal with No Apology, a record label, and formed a UK-based girl band called Boadicea in 2006. The band was managed by Ron Tom, founder and manager of All Saints and Sugarbabes. However, the group died two years later.

Seyi wrote and produced the soundtrack for the Konami game Crime Life, wrote You Will See for Mel C and White Lies for rapper ChipMunk.

She was also a part of the British Pop/RnB girl band From Above, and was the lead vocalist for the group.

In 2011, Sound Sultan motivated Seyi’s return to Nigeria during one of his visits to London. Later, she heeded his advice and went back to Nigeria to promote her career in the music industry. On her arrival, she was introduced to Cecil Hammond, who signed her under the Flytime Music Label.

In 2012, she released a single, Irawo, which became an instant hit and garnered massive airplay in Nigeria.

She later left Flytime Music and in July 2015, she signed an international record deal with Universal Island Records UK.

Seyi Shay in sunglasses. Photo: iamseyishay

Source: Instagram

The singer has released many hit singles. She released her debut studio album, Seyi or Shay, in 2015, and one EP titled Electric Package in 2018.

She started working on her debut album, Seyi or Shay, in 2011. In 2015, it was released under Island and Stargurl Limited.

Seyi or Shay was preceded by five singles: Murda (2014), Crazy (2014), Jangilova (2015), Right Now (2015) and Right Now – Remix (2015).

Seyi Shay has also worked with several local and international artists such as Justin Timberlake, Brian Michael Cox, Cameron Wallace, Cynthia Morgan, M.I Abaga, Olamide, Eva Alordiah, Yung Greg C, and many more.

Acting career

Seyi Shay starred in the 2018 Nigerian film, Lara and the Beat. The movie was directed by Tosin Coker and Tolu Olusoga. It also featured Vector, Somkele Iyamah, Wale Ojo, Sharon Ooja, Shaffy Bello and Uche Jombo.

Lara and the Beat centers on the beautiful Giwa sisters who are caught in the middle of a financial scandal with their late parents’ media empire. These sisters are forced out of their home and have to salvage their family’s legacy through music and business.

Seyi Shay husband

Is Seyi Shay married? No, she isn’t, but she made headlines earlier this year for her comments about marriage.

During a conversation with Seun Kuti and OAP Temi B on Simi's Stoopid Sessions show, she revealed that she would not mind if her husband had side chics.

Seyi revealed that as long as her husband is not keeping just one woman, she would be fine. According to her, if he keeps just one woman, they may fall in love and that may put her relationship with him at risk. However, if he has multiple side chics, their relationship would be safe.

She said:

"This is gonna sound somehow and I hope that other women don't try and bash me for it but I will actually be cool with my man having chics. As long as they're chics, and not one. Because if he has one chick on the side, then it's more likely that he's gonna fall in love with that one chic but if he's got like chics outside and he's doing his thing but I'm number one clearly in every way,"

She also revealed that she got engaged in 2019:

“ I actually got engaged last year. People that knew, knew, right? I had my ring on and everything – people thought it was a fashion ring or something but it was actually an engagement ring – and then a few months later we broke up.”

Explaining the reasons why the relationship ended, she revealed:

“We were already arguing about the whole wedding; there is a lot of stress when you are planning a wedding and I think somewhere in that all process, our relationship started to break down. Eventually, anyway, he was cheating on me and I found out because I walked in on the situation. I really wish I didn’t have to. So, the reason I decided and agreed to get married to this person is that I have a certain opinion on marriage. I don’t believe in the typical generalization of marriage. I don’t believe in that whole western type of ceremony or marriage – It is much deeper than that. Marriage to me is a bit more spiritual. It is much deeper than that. There is a type of glory that marriage gives you and your relationship as a woman or man and that is beyond the contract or the things you say to each other or the number of people in the ceremony.”
